steps.details: Warn residents and schools about intense brief rainfall and the risk of flash flooding.
Advise businesses to secure outdoor equipment and pause high-risk activities.
BBMP to position pumps and clearing crews at known local low points.
Temporarily suspend certain surface services in low-lying micro-catchments if needed.
Keep IMD and TMC tracking radar returns for rapid escalation triggers.
BWSSB to advise residents to boil water until turbidity and contamination tests clear.
Temporarily close or restrict access to ground-floor shops and schools near backflow zones.
Provide emergency cleansing and disinfection of contaminated public spaces.
Arrange tanker distribution to vulnerable households until mains are cleared.
Alert local clinics to watch for waterborne illness reports and set up reporting channels.
BESCOM to maintain shutdown of submerged transformer to prevent electrical hazards.

steps.action: Provide Alternative Power for Critical Loads
steps.details: Ensure hospitals and water pumps receive temporary power via generators.
Plan for dewatering and safe inspection before re-energizing the distribution network.
Publicly notify the ~1800 consumers about outage scope and restoration estimates.
Investigate drainage failures and transformer siting to inform future infrastructure resilience.
